org.monome.pages
Interface Page

All Known Implementing Classes:
AbletonClipLauncherPage, ExternalApplicationPage, MachineDrumInterfacePage, MIDIFadersPage, MIDIKeyboardPage, MIDISequencerPage, MIDITriggersPage, PageTemplate
public interface Page

The Page interface. All pages in the application must implement this interface.

Author:
Tom Dinchak

Method Detail

handlePress

void handlePress(int x,
                 int y,
                 int value)
Called whenever a press event is received on the monome this page belongs to.

Parameters:
x - The x coordinate of the pressed button
y - The y coordinate of the pressed button
value - The type of event (1 = button press, 0 = button release)

redrawMonome

void redrawMonome()
Called whenever the monome needs to be redrawn from the current page state. Should turn on or off every LED on the monome, even if the button is unused.

handleTick

void handleTick()
Called whenever a MIDI clock tick message is received from the selected MIDI input deviec.

getName

java.lang.String getName()
Returns the name of the page.

Returns:
The name of the page

getPanel

javax.swing.JPanel getPanel()
Returns the page's GUI panel.

Returns:
The GUI panel for the page

send

void send(javax.sound.midi.MidiMessage message,
          long timeStamp)
Called whenever a MIDI message is received from the MIDI input device

Parameters:
message - The MIDI message received
timeStamp - The timestamp that the message was received at

handleReset

void handleReset()
Called whenever a MIDI clock reset message is received on the selected MIDI input device.

toXml

java.lang.String toXml()
Called when a save configuration action is requested.

Returns:
XML representation of the page's current configuration.

actionPerformed

void actionPerformed(java.awt.event.ActionEvent e)
Called whenever a GUI action is received on a page's GUI (ie. a button is pressed).

Parameters:
e - The action event

addMidiOutDevice

void addMidiOutDevice(java.lang.String deviceName)
Adds or selects a MIDI output device for the page.

Parameters:
deviceName - The name of the device to use

getCacheDisabled

boolean getCacheDisabled()
Controls whether or not the LED state cache should be used for this page.

Returns:
true if the LED cache should be disabled

destroyPage

void destroyPage()
Should handle any cleanup needed when the page is destroyed (close open OSC ports, etc.)
